title: Johnny Sexton has faced the Haka in Japan before - and it did not end well - but this time he's hitting the right notes ahead of 'biggest match of my career'
text:
The last time Johnny Sexton faced the Haka in Japan, it did not end well. Ireland’s fly-half was 16 and the challenge was laid down in the World Rugby Invitational Youth Tournament, to which his school St Mary’s had been invited.

The boys arrived in Japan at midnight, Sexton recalled. They got up at 7.30am the next day to play their opening match. And they “got absolutely pumped”.

“They were probably the best [school] team in New Zealand,” Sexton said of Wesley College, the Auckland school which has produced an incredible number of All Blacks including one of the greatest of all time in Jonah Lomu.

description: The last time Johnny Sexton faced the Haka in Japan, it did not end well.
